授業方法: Most sessions are based on class room discussion. They are supplemented by extra documentary and other visual productions and also by a field study. Active participation in all of them is essential.  Students who fail to attend more than 20% of the classes will have 'Fail' in KGU's grading system.

第1回:
Globalization and Japanese Development: Course Orientation and Introduction

Documentary supplement: Pacific Century: Two Coasts of China
Analyze Japanese development through the perspective of Supply Side of Economic Growth Theory
第2回:
The Arrival of Commodore Perry and Modernization in Japan

Documentary Supplement: Pacific Century: Meiji Revolution
Analyze Japan's Encounter with the West and Response through contending theories of state-society relations
第3回: Industrialization, the Rise of Militarists and Colonization in Imperial Japan
Apply systems analysis to the causes of the rise of Japanese militarism
第4回:
Japan's Attack on Pearl Harbor and Defeat

Documentary Supplement: Road to the Pacific War (in Japanese) by NHK & Hiroshima by BBC
Apply rational decision-making theory to Japan's attack on Pearl Harbor and US ab-bomb drop in Hiroshima and Nagasaki
第5回:
Cultural Diversity and Multiculturalism in Modern Japan

Digital Field Study: Multicultural Kobe - the Case of Sugihara's Transit VISA & 4,500 Jewish Refugees
第6回:
The Allied Occupation of Japan and Postwar Development

Documentary supplement: Pacific Century: Remaking Japan
Analyze the Major Objectives of the Occupation and Achievements
第7回:
The Postwar Japanese Political Economy

Documentary Supplement: Pacific Century
Apply contending perspectives on the rise and fall of Japan as the 2nd largest economic power in the international system
第8回:
Contending Perspectives on Japan's Postwar Constitution

Documentary supplment: Postwar Japanese Constitution
Analyse in what way and to what extent the current Japanese constitution is made by Japanese.
